info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 24 at 2:17PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...BLIZZARD CONDITIONS WILL ARRIVE BACK INTO THE BUFFALO METRO AREA THIS AFTERNOON... HAZARDS...The combination of a band of heavy snow and winds gusting to 55 mph at times is producing BLIZZARD conditions. Visibility within the band is ZERO. There are numerous vehicles stranded on the roadways with many roads impassable. DO NOT attempt to travel in this band. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 213 PM EST, a narrow 10 mile wide band of heavy snow extended from Grand Island northeast across the Buffalo Northtowns and the southern half of Niagara County, including the city of Niagara Falls. This band is expected to slowly drift to the south, with the BLIZZARD conditions becoming more focused on the Buffalo metro area through 4 PM, including the city of Buffalo. The blizzard conditions will then last at least into this evening. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Buffalo, Cheektowaga, Niagara Falls, West Seneca, North Tonawanda, Clarence, Lockport, Lackawanna, Kenmore, Depew, Tonawanda, Amherst, Lancaster, Medina, Albion, Williamsville, Grand Island, Pendleton, Pembroke and Akron. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 48A and 54. SAFETY INFO... Travel is impossible in this area with blizzard conditions. &&
